feed.title: SAP Community - ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model
feed.subtitle: ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: BTP Trial Account RAP Application's Preview feature Not Working, returning 403 Http Status
entry.content:
Hello all,

We are trying to create a simple RAP list application in BTP Trial Account (Subaccount hosted in US EAST AWS), but noticed that the preview of the UI is not working and rendering as a blank object. It's noted that Error code 403 forbidden is being returned from the back-end network calls,

We observed that when we try to preview any of the SAP shipped sample programs like the one belonging to /DMO/FLIGHT , things work fine and this Network call is executed without any issues.

Is anyone facing this issue ? and is there any other solution rather than deleting the subaccount and creating a new one with the Singapore Azure Services opted ?

It seems already many are facing this issue:

1.) https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-q-a/sap-btp-trial-account-published-services-not-working/qaq-p/14216629

2.) https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/i-am-getting-a-blank-page-when-i-preview-my-rap-service-binding-in-the-btp/qaq-p/14244244

No idea why SAP is paying no heed to these systems which are surely used by lot of developers for Up-skilling, Training, POC Sample application creation and lot such activities.

Thanks,

Sijin

entry.title: SAP BTP Trial Account RAP application's preview feature is not work
entry.content:
Then  this popup occurred

 

When I opened Inspect in the browser console, I found the following error:

Log-dbg.js:497 2025-11-05 18:51:11.574300 GET /sap/opu/odata4/sap/zas_ux/srvd/sap/zas_pd_service/0001/$metadata - Could not load metadata: 403 Forbidden sap.ui.model.odata.v4.lib._MetadataRequestor
u @ Log-dbg.js:497
2_Helper-dbg.js:617 Uncaught (in promise) Error: Could not load metadata: 403 Forbidden


When I test the API directly, it also throws an error.

entry.title: Trial System not available for Restful ABAP development
entry.content:
Currently it is not possible to do Restful ABAP development on Trial Systems.

You cannot test the published OData service as you get errors.

When will the Trial system be fully available again?

It is so much annoying to work on a system that is not fully functional and you do not know, what the problem is..

entry.title: How to Create/Post STO Purchase order Using API in S4H On-premise or Private Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

Can we Create STO using Purchase Order API?Since API: sap-s4-CE_STOCKTRANSPORTORDER_0001 works only on  Public Cloud , what are other API can we use for Private Cloud or  On-Premise?

Reference Previous Blog:

https://community.sap.com/t5/supply-chain-management-q-a/unable-to-create-post-sto-purchase-order-using-bo-api/qaq-p/14076513

Thanks,

Jaman

entry.title: Error in SAP RAP Documentation
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

While going through the SAP RAP documentation, I came across something that seems a bit confusing. It mentions that during an unmanaged save scenario, we should not include the persistent table. However in the sample code, a persistent table is mentioned along with unmanaged save. But persistent table is not mentioned in the additional save scenario. It seems like these two cases might have been interchanged.

@Andre_Fischer 

TIA.

entry.title: OData Service FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE (Entity Set C_AssetBalanceOverviewResult)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

When trying to fetch data from the entity set C_AssetBalanceOverviewResult of the OData service FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE, I encountered an issue related to the input parameters.

The service metadata for C_AssetBalanceOverviewParameters exposes the following parameters:
P_CompanyCode
P_CurrencyRole
P_FiscalPeriod
P_FiscalYear
P_Ledger
However, in the underlying CDS Data Definition C_AssetBalanceOverview, I see additional parameters:
define view C_AssetBalanceOverview
with parameters
P_TodayDate : fagl_keydate,
P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet : faa_key_figure_set,
P_CompanyCode : fis_bukrs,
P_Ledger : fis_rldnr,
P_FiscalYear : fis_ryear,
P_FiscalPeriod : fis_poper,
P_CurrencyRole : fis_curtp,
P_FiscalPeriodEndDate : fagl_keydate (derived automatically)

The parameters P_TodayDate and P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet are marked with @Consumption.hidden, so they are not visible in the OData metadata.

When I call the OData service and provide only the visible parameters:
P_CompanyCode
P_CurrencyRole
P_FiscalPeriod
P_FiscalYear
P_Ledger
I receive a short dump: CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR in object FAA_ASSET_OVERVIEWPAGE.

Question:

  1. Are the parameters being passed correctly according to the design of this CDS consumption view and OData service?

  2. How should the hidden parameters (P_TodayDate and P_AssetAccountingKeyFigureSet) be handled when calling the OData service?

  3. Is there a known workaround or recommended approach to avoid the CX_SADL_DUMP_APPL_MODEL_ERROR for this scenario?

Any guidance or reference documentation would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: ABAP RAP Preview not working at all
entry.content:
Hi,

I am currently learning RAP and following the training: "Build an SAP Fiori App elements using the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model". I have done everything as instructed, but the preview is not working. I have tried both OData V2 and OData V4, but unfortunately it has not worked.

I keep getting this message: The app could not be opened...

I‚Äôm stuck at this point and would really appreciate any guidance on what might be going wrong or what else I can check.

Thanks,

entry.title: ABAP RAP - Enable/Disable Static Action on Child entity & Autorefresh post adding row
entry.content:
Hi,

I have created  Simple RAP list report with managed scenario( Travel --- > Booking ),I have enable massupload in booking entity using static action.Post implementing the logic i am facing below issues, please guide me how to fix it.

1. Static Action --> Created button shoould display only when object page in edit mode,present its displaying  both  case( display & Edit mode)
2. Post uploading the child entity table bot refreshed automatically,i am unable to use side effects i have used static action.

Is  possible to achieve above points via RAP ?

entry.title: Adapt UI on SAP Fiori app RAP deployed on Cloud Foundry
entry.content:
Hi guys, my backend is SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.SAP Fiori

We developed a RAP application embedded in Public Cloud, and a Fiori frontend on BTP deployed on Cloud Foundry.

Now the user wants to save variants of this app ‚Äî default values, hidden fields, etc. Basically, they want the Adapt UI functionality that exists in S/4HANA Public Cloud, but for apps deployed on Cloud Foundry and running in Work Zone.

Is this possible?

entry.title: Issue with Download Template Functionality in RAP-Based Mass Upload Table (ADT)
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I‚Äôve implemented a table with a mass upload feature, but the ‚ÄúDownload Template‚Äù option isn‚Äôt working as expected.

I created an abstract entity with a rawstring data type and additional parameters to accept the attachment. In the behavior definition, I‚Äôve defined a static action to generate the Excel file and assign it to the result. However, while I can successfully upload the template using similar approach, the download functionality doesn‚Äôt trigger, and no errors are shown.

Please find the screenshot below for your reference.
Could you please review my approach and let me know if I‚Äôm missing something or if any changes are required?

Abstract entity:

Behavior definition and implementing class:

Thank you in Advance.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model  SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Research and Development ABAP Development

entry.title: RAP event - Additional save > Raise Event > INSERT generates shortdump
entry.content:
Whenever the user calls an OData service, I need to save the data to a table and immediately trigger additional actions. In my case, the preparing and printing of a custom form based on the saved data. In the current setup this generates a shortdump.

To get this to work, I'm using the "with additional save" option within the behavior definition. This provides me with the 'save_modified' method to handle my additional save. If I simply perform an INSERT there, the record is inserted into the database without issue.

However, to properly decouple the process, I raise an entity event 'created', which is defined in the behavior definition.

METHOD save_modified.
    data lt_header type table for event zlp_os_i_del_hdr\\Header~created.
    lt_header = corresponding #( create-header ).
    RAISE ENTITY EVENT ZLP_OS_I_DEL_Hdr\\Header~created from lt_header.
ENDMETHOD.

This event is handled by a separate class.

METHODS:
  consume_created FOR ENTITY EVENT created_instances FOR Header~created.

method consume_created.
  " INSERT here results in shortdump

  loop at created_instances into data(ls_created).
    zlp_os_cl_delivery=>print_label( ls_created-HeaderGuid ).
  endloop.
endmethod.

Normally, in this method, the label is prepared and placed in a print queue. That last step is done using a standard SAP class, which eventually performs an INSERT.

cl_print_queue_utils=>create_queue_item_by_data(
  iv_qname            = lv_printer
  iv_print_data       = lv_pdf
  iv_name_of_main_doc = |Label date/time|
  iv_number_of_copies = 1
).

In case I perform my INSERT there, the system dumps. 

Execution takes place in a transactional context: A "PHASE <modify>" call is
active with "ZLP_OS_BROKER_DELIVERY". The current statement "INSERT <dbtab>" is therefore forbidden.

I was under the impression that the additional save would prevent this from happening. But it seems the event creates a new RAP phase, in which I still can't INSERT anything.

Am I going about this the wrong way? Thanks in advance for the help üôÇ

---

Apologies for the Label, the 'Labels' box only accepts the proposed 'GenAI Assisted Content' although this has nothing to do with the subject ü§î won't let me post without labels, so it is what it is.

entry.title: Batch Management - Change Events - Clean Core Extensibility
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I have a question regarding the right strategy when implementing a customer specific logic in batch management.

The scenario is as follows: 

- There are a couple of batch characteristics which are required to be determined by an external system.

- Whenever a batch is created or changed, it is required to call a couple services (of a third party application) and to persist the results in the batch characteristics and a customer specific table (ODATA Sevices exist). Depending on attributes of the batch and related objects based on different rules different services need to be called and different data needs to be manipulated / persisted.

- Of course, clean core is the Target.

 

Now two approaches are discussed:

(1) implement event(s) in BTP - apply logic etc.

(2) Use RAP - implement event -  apply mentioned logic

Event description here

I have a little experience in BTP and no with RAP. I wonder

(a) are both approaches possible? 
(b) what would be the advantages? Does anyone have experience with a similar scenario?

(c) Are there any limitations you see?

Thanks a lot in advance üôÇ

entry.title: Introduction to API in SAP ABAP
entry.content:
Introduction to REST APIs in SAP ABAP ‚Äì A Beginner-Friendly Guide

In today‚Äôs digital landscape, integration is at the heart of every business process. Whether it‚Äôs connecting SAP with e-commerce platforms, CRMs, payment gateways, or cloud applications‚ÄîAPIs play a crucial role in making systems communicate smoothly and securely.

As SAP evolves, an ABAP developer is no longer limited to classical reports and enhancements.

We now work in a world where REST APIs, JSON payloads, and HTTP calls are becoming everyday essentials.

This blog marks Part 1 of my API Series for SAP Developers, where I break down core API concepts in simple words, along with how they relate to SAP ABAP.

What is an API? 

  • API stands for Application Programming Interface‚Äîa structured way for two systems to communicate.

Think of an API as a messenger that carries a request from one system and brings back a response from another.

For example:

  • SAP retrieving live weather details from a weather API
  • SAP sending order data to a third-party logistics system
  • SAP fetching exchange rates from an external service

Understanding REST and RESTful APIs

  • REST (Representational State Transfer) is an architectural style that defines how systems interact using simple, lightweight standards‚Äîusually over HTTP.

A REST API follows these REST principles and works on the basis of:

‚û°Ô∏è A Request sent by the client

‚û°Ô∏è A Response returned by the server

This makes REST APIs fast, scalable, and widely used.

Structure of an API Request

A typical API request consists of four key elements:

1. Endpoint

  • The URL where the request is sent.

Example: /weather/data/city=Berlin

2. Method (HTTP Verb)

  • Defines the action to perform.

Method Purpose:

  1. GET Retrieve data
  2. POST Create new data
  3. PUT Replace/update full data
  4. PATCH Update partial data
  5. DELETE Remove data

3. Headers

  • Used for authentication (API key, bearer token) and metadata (content type, encoding).

4. Body (Payload)

  • The actual data being sent‚Äîusually JSON or XML.

Example (JSON):

{

  "city": "Berlin",

  "unit": "celsius"

}

Prerequisites in SAP to Consume an API:

  • Before calling an API from SAP ABAP, ensure:
  • ‚úî SICF Service is Active
  • SAP uses ICF (Internet Communication Framework) for HTTP/HTTPS calls.
  • Transaction: SICF
  • ‚úî Required Authorizations
  • Your user should have permissions for:
  • Making HTTP calls
  • Accessing destinations
  • Using classes like CL_HTTP_CLIENT

How SAP ABAP Communicates with APIs:

API provides robust classes to make HTTP calls:

  • CL_HTTP_CLIENT ‚Äì Create and send requests
  • IF_HTTP_CLIENT ‚Äì Handle and process responses

With these, you can:

‚úî Send GET/POST/PUT/PATCH/DELETE calls

‚úî Send JSON/XML body

‚úî Read and parse JSON responses

‚úî Connect SAP to external cloud services

This opens doors to integrations like:

  •  Fetching weather data
  • Connecting to payment gateways
  • Sending delivery data to logistics providers
  • Communicating with AI/ML APIs

Example Use Cases for APIs in ABAP

Here are some real-world scenarios where ABAP developers use APIs:

1. Integrating SAP with a CRM

  • Send customer details to Salesforce or HubSpot using POST calls.

2. Fetching Live Data

  • Retrieve stock prices, exchange rates, or weather details in real time.

3. Automating External Processes

  • Send purchase order confirmations to vendor portals.

4. Connecting SAP to Cloud Applications

  • Use REST APIs to integrate SAP with cloud apps, chatbots, mobile apps, and dashboards.

Conclusion

  • In modern SAP landscapes, REST APIs are not just a concept‚Äîthey are a necessity.

As an ABAP developer, understanding APIs empowers you to:

  • Build smarter integrations
  • Automate cross-platform workflows
  • Connect SAP with the outside world
  • Stay aligned with SAP‚Äôs shift toward cloud and digital transformation
  • This blog sets the foundation.

Stay tuned for Part 2 of the API series!

Your feedback and suggestions are always welcome. üòä

entry.title: Query about non factory static action in RAP
entry.content:
I have a doubt regarding non factory static action defined in RAP (for this example, lets consider in RAP Managed).

So there is a list report, where an action button "IncreasePrice" is visible (even when none of the record is selected) as the action is defined as static. Till here , its fine.

Now when I go to implement the method for this action in behaviour implementation, I see there is importing parameter "keys" which contains only %cid. So I have the below questions now.

1) Since I have defined non factory static instance, which means its not for CREATION of instances and not applicable to a particular instance , then what is the use of this importing parameter "keys" which contains %cid ?

2) I observed that when i select , lets say 3 records from the list report and click on this action, the corresponding method gets triggered thrice, which is surprising for me because this is supposed to be a static action to be triggered on the entity level and not on instance level. Imagine if I am writing some logic to be applied at entity level, it will be called 3 times because of this , which is not expected from static action I think.

3) In the implementation method for this action, if I have to apply some change in value for all instances of this entity (something which is expected from a static action) , I guess I would need to loop through all the instances and use MODIFY Entities to do that.

But to loop through the instances, I will need to maybe first READ all the instances in an itab using READ ENTITIES , however in READ ENTITIES we are supposed to give some where condition for keys and in this static action, I do not have anything apart from %cid in the importing parameter , so how do i READ all the records. (Or maybe there is some other way to do which I am unaware).

Thanks a lot in advance.

entry.title: INTRO TO REST API IN SAP ABAP.
entry.content:
REST API in SAP ABAP ‚Äì A Complete Developer-Friendly Guide (Part 2)

By: Nidhi Patekar

üîπ Introduction

  • This blog is Part 2 of my series on understanding APIs in SAP ABAP.

In Part 1, we explored:

‚úî What is an API

‚úî Why we use APIs

‚úî Basic concepts of communication between systems

In this Part 2, we will dive into the world of REST APIs, understand how they work, how SAP uses them, and how ABAP developers interact with REST principles through OData, CRUD operations, DPC methods, and RAP.

This blog is written in simple language and is ideal for:

  • ABAP beginners
  • Developers working on SAP‚Äìnon-SAP integrations
  • Students learning API concepts
  • SAP professionals working on Fiori / RAP / OData services

üöÄ Understanding REST API

What is REST API?

  • REST stands for Representational State Transfer.
  • It is a lightweight, scalable, stateless architectural style used to build web services.
  • A REST API allows two systems to communicate using standard HTTP methods such as:

GET ‚Äì Read data

POST ‚Äì Create new data

PUT ‚Äì Update an entire record

PATCH ‚Äì Partially update a record

DELETE ‚Äì Remove a record

  • REST APIs mostly exchange data in JSON format, making them modern and easy to integrate with mobile/web applications.

ü•ó Simple Analogy ‚Äì API as a Waiter

To understand this better, imagine a restaurant:

REST Concept Restaurant Example

  • Client You
  • Request Giving an order
  • API Waiter who carries your order
  • Server Kitchen
  • Data Prepared food
  • Response Food delivered back to you
  • The waiter (API) ensures proper communication between you (the client) and the kitchen (the server).

üåê How REST API Works (SAP Context)

  • A client sends a request like:
  • GET /SalesOrders('SO1234')
  • SAP receives the request ‚Üí executes backend ABAP logic ‚Üí sends back data in JSON/XML format.
  • REST API = Request (URL + Method) + Response (Data + Status Code)

üß© Why REST API is Used in SAP?

  • REST APIs are the backbone of modern SAP integration.

They are used to:

‚úî Transfer data between SAP and non-SAP systems

‚úî Build lightweight mobile or web apps

‚úî Connect SAP to cloud services

‚úî Power SAP Fiori applications

‚úî Enable RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model)

‚úî Expose SAP business data securely

üìå Understanding HTTP Methods With SAP Examples:

  • REST APIs use HTTP methods to perform CRUD operations.
  • Below is each method explained with real SAP ABAP examples.

1Ô∏è‚É£ GET ‚Äì Retrieve Data

  • Used for reading data from SAP backend.

Example Request:

  • GET /SalesOrders('SO1234')

üìå SAP Functionality: Fetch Sales Order details

üìå ABAP Implementation (OData):

  • Handled inside GET_ENTITY or GET_ENTITYSET methods of DPC_EXT.

Usage in SAP:

  • Fiori List Reports
  • Analytical apps
  • External systems fetching SAP master data

2Ô∏è‚É£ POST ‚Äì Create Data

  • Used for creating new entries.

Example Request:

POST /Customers

{

  "CustomerName": "Ravi Traders",

  "City": "Pune",

  "Email": "ravi@example.com"

}

 

üìå SAP Output: New customer is created.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

Mapped to CREATE_ENTITY in DPC_EXT.

Used in:

  • Fiori Create screens
  • External apps creating orders/customers
  • B2B integrations

3Ô∏è‚É£ PUT ‚Äì Full Update

  • Replaces an entire record.

Example Request:

PUT /Materials('MAT001')

{

  "MaterialName": "Steel Rod",

  "Weight": "15kg",

  "Category": "Raw Material"

}

üìå SAP Output:

  • Material updated or created if not present.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

  • Handled by UPDATE_ENTITY.

4Ô∏è‚É£ PATCH ‚Äì Partial Update

  • Only specific fields are updated.

Example:

PATCH /SalesOrders('SO1234')

{

  "DeliveryDate": "2025-11-15"

}

üìå SAP Output:

  • Only the Delivery Date changes.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

  • Handled in UPDATE_ENTITY, with conditional logic.

5Ô∏è‚É£ DELETE ‚Äì Remove Data

Example:

  • DELETE /Customers('CUST789')

üìå SAP Output:

  • Customer record deleted.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

  • Mapped to DELETE_ENTITY.

üß† Mapping HTTP Methods to DPC Methods

  • HTTP Method Purpose DPC_EXT Method
  • GET Read data GET_ENTITY / GET_ENTITYSET
  • POST Create data CREATE_ENTITY
  • PUT / PATCH Update data UPDATE_ENTITY
  • DELETE Remove data DELETE_ENTITY

üß± What is DPC & DPC_EXT in SAP OData?

  • When you create an OData service in SEGW, SAP generates two key classes:

1Ô∏è‚É£ MPC ‚Äì Model Provider Class

Defines the data model:

  • Entity Types
  • Properties
  • Associations

2Ô∏è‚É£ DPC ‚Äì Data Provider Class

  • Contains the logic for CRUD operations.

Why DPC_EXT Exists?

  • SAP generates DPC automatically
  • You should never edit the base class
  • Instead, write custom logic in DPC_EXT

Example:

  • To customize GET_ENTITY, you override it in
  • ZCL_<project>_DPC_EXT

üìç Where Does SAP Use REST API Concepts?

  • Even though ABAP developers don‚Äôt always create ‚ÄúREST APIs‚Äù directly, REST architecture is everywhere:

‚úî SAP OData Services

  • OData is a REST-based protocol.

‚úî SAP Fiori Apps

  • Fiori UI consumes OData REST services.

‚úî SAP Cloud Integrations

  • REST ‚Üí CPI ‚Üí SAP.

‚úî RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model)

  • RAP automatically generates REST/OData services.

‚úî External System Integrations

  • Non-SAP ‚Üí REST ‚Üí SAP ABAP logic.

üîÑ What is OData?

  • OData (Open Data Protocol) is a REST-based protocol widely used by SAP.

OData allows:

  • CRUD operations
  • Metadata access
  • Standardized URLs
  • Easy integration with Fiori and UI5
  • Tools to create OData:
  • SEGW (classic)
  • RAP (modern)

üü¶ What is RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model)?

  • RAP is SAP‚Äôs latest and modern approach.

RAP includes:

  • CDS Views
  • Behaviors
  • Metadata annotations
  • Automatic OData service generation

Advantages:

  • Clean architecture
  • Reusable logic
  • Better performance
  • Cloud-ready development

‚öñ Difference: OData (Classic) vs RAP

  • Feature Classic OData (SEGW) RAP
  • Tool SEGW ADT (Eclipse
  • CRUD Logic DPC_EXT coding Behavior class
  • Data Model Manually defined CDS-driven
  • Use Case On-premise systems Cloud-ready apps
  • OData Generation Manual Automatic

üéØ Summary

In this Part 2 blog, we covered:

‚úî What REST API is

‚úî Why REST API is important in SAP ABAP

‚úî HTTP methods explained through SAP business examples

‚úî CRUD operations and their mapping to OData DPC methods

‚úî Importance of DPC & DPC_EXT classes

‚úî Where REST concepts are applied in SAP

‚úî Introduction to OData & RAP

Understanding REST API concepts is essential for SAP ABAP developers, especially in today‚Äôs environment where SAP must connect seamlessly with cloud platforms, mobile apps, and external systems.

entry.title: INTRO TO REST API IN SAP ABAP
entry.content:
REST API in SAP ABAP ‚Äì A Complete Developer-Friendly Guide (Part 2)

By: Nidhi Patekar

üîπ Introduction

  • This blog is Part 2 of my series on understanding APIs in SAP ABAP.

In Part 1, we explored:

‚úî What is an API

‚úî Why we use APIs

‚úî Basic concepts of communication between systems

In this Part 2, we will dive into the world of REST APIs, understand how they work, how SAP uses them, and how ABAP developers interact with REST principles through OData, CRUD operations, DPC methods, and RAP.

This blog is written in simple language and is ideal for:

  • ABAP beginners
  • Developers working on SAP‚Äìnon-SAP integrations
  • Students learning API concepts
  • SAP professionals working on Fiori / RAP / OData services

üöÄ Understanding REST API

What is REST API?

  • REST stands for Representational State Transfer.
  • It is a lightweight, scalable, stateless architectural style used to build web services.
  • A REST API allows two systems to communicate using standard HTTP methods such as:

GET ‚Äì Read data

POST ‚Äì Create new data

PUT ‚Äì Update an entire record

PATCH ‚Äì Partially update a record

DELETE ‚Äì Remove a record

  • REST APIs mostly exchange data in JSON format, making them modern and easy to integrate with mobile/web applications.

ü•ó Simple Analogy ‚Äì API as a Waiter

To understand this better, imagine a restaurant:

REST Concept Restaurant Example

  • Client You
  • Request Giving an order
  • API Waiter who carries your order
  • Server Kitchen
  • Data Prepared food
  • Response Food delivered back to you
  • The waiter (API) ensures proper communication between you (the client) and the kitchen (the server).

üåê How REST API Works (SAP Context)

  • A client sends a request like:
  • GET /SalesOrders('SO1234')
  • SAP receives the request ‚Üí executes backend ABAP logic ‚Üí sends back data in JSON/XML format.
  • REST API = Request (URL + Method) + Response (Data + Status Code)

üß© Why REST API is Used in SAP?

  • REST APIs are the backbone of modern SAP integration.

They are used to:

‚úî Transfer data between SAP and non-SAP systems

‚úî Build lightweight mobile or web apps

‚úî Connect SAP to cloud services

‚úî Power SAP Fiori applications

‚úî Enable RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model)

‚úî Expose SAP business data securely

üìå Understanding HTTP Methods With SAP Examples:

  • REST APIs use HTTP methods to perform CRUD operations.
  • Below is each method explained with real SAP ABAP examples.

1Ô∏è‚É£ GET ‚Äì Retrieve Data

  • Used for reading data from SAP backend.

Example Request:

  • GET /SalesOrders('SO1234')

üìå SAP Functionality: Fetch Sales Order details

üìå ABAP Implementation (OData):

  • Handled inside GET_ENTITY or GET_ENTITYSET methods of DPC_EXT.

Usage in SAP:

  • Fiori List Reports
  • Analytical apps
  • External systems fetching SAP master data

2Ô∏è‚É£ POST ‚Äì Create Data

  • Used for creating new entries.

Example Request:

POST /Customers

{

  "CustomerName": "Ravi Traders",

  "City": "Pune",

  "Email": "ravi@example.com"

}

 

üìå SAP Output: New customer is created.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

Mapped to CREATE_ENTITY in DPC_EXT.

Used in:

  • Fiori Create screens
  • External apps creating orders/customers
  • B2B integrations

3Ô∏è‚É£ PUT ‚Äì Full Update

  • Replaces an entire record.

Example Request:

PUT /Materials('MAT001')

{

  "MaterialName": "Steel Rod",

  "Weight": "15kg",

  "Category": "Raw Material"

}

üìå SAP Output:

  • Material updated or created if not present.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

  • Handled by UPDATE_ENTITY.

4Ô∏è‚É£ PATCH ‚Äì Partial Update

  • Only specific fields are updated.

Example:

PATCH /SalesOrders('SO1234')

{

  "DeliveryDate": "2025-11-15"

}

üìå SAP Output:

  • Only the Delivery Date changes.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

  • Handled in UPDATE_ENTITY, with conditional logic.

5Ô∏è‚É£ DELETE ‚Äì Remove Data

Example:

  • DELETE /Customers('CUST789')

üìå SAP Output:

  • Customer record deleted.

üìå ABAP Implementation:

  • Mapped to DELETE_ENTITY.

üß† Mapping HTTP Methods to DPC Methods

  • HTTP Method Purpose DPC_EXT Method
  • GET Read data GET_ENTITY / GET_ENTITYSET
  • POST Create data CREATE_ENTITY
  • PUT / PATCH Update data UPDATE_ENTITY
  • DELETE Remove data DELETE_ENTITY

üß± What is DPC & DPC_EXT in SAP OData?

  • When you create an OData service in SEGW, SAP generates two key classes:

1Ô∏è‚É£ MPC ‚Äì Model Provider Class

Defines the data model:

  • Entity Types
  • Properties
  • Associations

2Ô∏è‚É£ DPC ‚Äì Data Provider Class

  • Contains the logic for CRUD operations.

Why DPC_EXT Exists?

  • SAP generates DPC automatically
  • You should never edit the base class
  • Instead, write custom logic in DPC_EXT

Example:

  • To customize GET_ENTITY, you override it in
  • ZCL_<project>_DPC_EXT

üìç Where Does SAP Use REST API Concepts?

  • Even though ABAP developers don‚Äôt always create ‚ÄúREST APIs‚Äù directly, REST architecture is everywhere:

‚úî SAP OData Services

  • OData is a REST-based protocol.

‚úî SAP Fiori Apps

  • Fiori UI consumes OData REST services.

‚úî SAP Cloud Integrations

  • REST ‚Üí CPI ‚Üí SAP.

‚úî RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model)

  • RAP automatically generates REST/OData services.

‚úî External System Integrations

  • Non-SAP ‚Üí REST ‚Üí SAP ABAP logic.

üîÑ What is OData?

  • OData (Open Data Protocol) is a REST-based protocol widely used by SAP.

OData allows:

  • CRUD operations
  • Metadata access
  • Standardized URLs
  • Easy integration with Fiori and UI5
  • Tools to create OData:
  • SEGW (classic)
  • RAP (modern)

üü¶ What is RAP (RESTful ABAP Programming Model)?

  • RAP is SAP‚Äôs latest and modern approach.

RAP includes:

  • CDS Views
  • Behaviors
  • Metadata annotations
  • Automatic OData service generation

Advantages:

  • Clean architecture
  • Reusable logic
  • Better performance
  • Cloud-ready development

‚öñ Difference: OData (Classic) vs RAP

  • Feature Classic OData (SEGW) RAP
  • Tool SEGW ADT (Eclipse
  • CRUD Logic DPC_EXT coding Behavior class
  • Data Model Manually defined CDS-driven
  • Use Case On-premise systems Cloud-ready apps
  • OData Generation Manual Automatic

üéØ Summary

In this Part 2 blog, we covered:

‚úî What REST API is

‚úî Why REST API is important in SAP ABAP

‚úî HTTP methods explained through SAP business examples

‚úî CRUD operations and their mapping to OData DPC methods

‚úî Importance of DPC & DPC_EXT classes

‚úî Where REST concepts are applied in SAP

‚úî Introduction to OData & RAP

Understanding REST API concepts is essential for SAP ABAP developers, especially in today‚Äôs environment where SAP must connect seamlessly with cloud platforms, mobile apps, and external systems.

entry.title: Issue with CDS Join for SD & FI Documents for Custom IRN RAP Application
entry.content:
Hello Expert,

I am working on a custom RAP based Fiori Elements Application for IRN and E-Way Bill Generation. Currently, we generate the IRN using the SD Document Type based on the CDS view I_BillingDocumentBasic.

As per the new requirement, we also need to include FI Documents, so we are using the CDS view I_JournalEntryItem. Our objective is to retrieve DG and DR documents using a UNION ALL, but we are facing an issue where some required fields are not appearing. I have attached a Code of the CDS view which we have  Developed.

Could anyone guide us on what might be causing the join issue or how we can achieve this requirement in our custom IRN application?

We have created two CDS views one is a join of the FI and SD document CDS views, and the another is the Backend CDS view used for IRN Generation where we fetch the Document Type.

Please find the attached First CDS view which has Join logic for both the SD and FI Document CDS views.

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Billing and FICO Document Type Join'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define view entity ZI_INV_FI_DOC_JOIN
  as select from I_BillingDocumentBasic     as VBRK

    inner join   I_BillingDocumentItemBasic as VBRP on VBRK.BillingDocument = VBRP.BillingDocument
{
  key VBRK.BillingDocument         as BillingDocument,
  key VBRP.BillingDocumentItem     as BillingDocumentItem,
      VBRK.CompanyCode             as CompanyCode,
      VBRK.BillingDocumentType     as BillingDocumentType,
      VBRK.AccountingExchangeRate  as AccountingExchangeRate,
      VBRK.DocumentReferenceID     as DocumentReferenceID,
      VBRK.BillingDocumentDate     as BillingDocumentDate,
      VBRK.CreationDate            as CreationDate,
      VBRK.PayerParty              as Customer,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
      VBRK.TotalNetAmount          as TotalNetAmount,
      VBRK.TransactionCurrency     as TransactionCurrency,
      VBRP.Plant                   as Plant,
      VBRP.ReferenceSDDocument     as ReferenceSDDocument,
      VBRP.ReferenceSDDocumentItem as ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
      VBRP.Material                as Material,
      @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BillingQuantityUnit'
      VBRP.BillingQuantity         as BillingQuantity,
      VBRP.BillingQuantityUnit     as BillingQuantityUnit,
      VBRP.BaseUnit                as BaseUnit,
      @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
      VBRP.NetAmount               as NetAmount
}
union all select from I_JournalEntry     as BKPF
  inner join          I_JournalEntryItem as ACDOCA on BKPF.AccountingDocument = ACDOCA.AccountingDocument
{
  key BKPF.AccountingDocument                             as BillingDocument,
  key cast(ACDOCA.AccountingDocumentItem as abap.char(6)) as BillingDocumentItem,
      BKPF.CompanyCode                                    as CompanyCode,
      BKPF.AccountingDocumentType                         as BillingDocumentType,
      BKPF.ExchangeRate                                   as AccountingExchangeRate,
      BKPF.DocumentReferenceID                            as DocumentReferenceID,
      BKPF. PostingDate                                   as BillingDocumentDate,
      ACDOCA.CreationDate                                 as CreationDate,
      ACDOCA.Customer                                     as Customer,
      ACDOCA.AmountInTransactionCurrency                  as TotalNetAmount,
      ACDOCA.TransactionCurrency                          as TransactionCurrency,
      ACDOCA.Plant                                        as Plant,
      BKPF.DocumentReferenceID                            as ReferenceSDDocument,
      ACDOCA.SourceReferenceDocumentItem                  as ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
      ACDOCA.Product                                      as Material,
      ACDOCA.Quantity                                     as BillingQuantity,
      ACDOCA.ReferenceQuantityUnit                        as BillingQuantityUnit,
      ACDOCA.BaseUnit                                     as BaseUnit,
      ACDOCA.AmountInTransactionCurrency                  as NetAmount
}

 

Here is the another CDS view where we are using this CDS view in the background for fetching the Document Type of SD & FI.

 

@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'view entity to pick Invoice number'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define root view entity ZBR_INV_EDOC_PICK
       with parameters
       iv_fkdat : abap.dats
  as select from    ZI_INV_FI_DOC_JOIN            as _VBRK_BKPF

    left outer join I_ProductText                 as MAKT      on MAKT.Product = _VBRK_BKPF.Material
    left outer join I_Plant                       as t001w     on t001w.Plant = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
    inner join      I_Customer                    as KNA1      on KNA1.Customer = _VBRK_BKPF.Customer
  
    inner join      ZR_EDOC_TYPE                  as EIDOCTYPE on  EIDOCTYPE.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
                                                               and EIDOCTYPE.BillingType = _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentType
  
    inner join      I_ProductPlantBasic           as marc      on  marc.Product = _VBRK_BKPF.Material
                                                               and marc.Plant   = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
    inner join      I_CompanyCode                 as t001      on t001.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
    left outer join I_IN_PlantBusinessPlaceDetail as PBplace   on  PBplace.Plant       = _VBRK_BKPF.Plant
                                                               and PBplace.CompanyCode = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
    left outer join I_IN_BusinessPlaceTaxDetail   as BBRANCH   on  BBRANCH.CompanyCode   = _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode
                                                               and BBRANCH.BusinessPlace = PBplace.BusinessPlace

  association [0..1] to I_Currency      as _TransactionCurrency on $projection.TransactionCurrency = _TransactionCurrency.Currency
  association [0..1] to I_UnitOfMeasure as _BillingQuantityUnit on $projection.BillingQuantityUnit = _BillingQuantityUnit.UnitOfMeasure
{
  key  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocument,
  key  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentItem,
       _VBRK_BKPF.CompanyCode,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentType,
       _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate,
       _VBRK_BKPF.DocumentReferenceID,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingDocumentDate,
       _VBRK_BKPF.CreationDate,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.TotalNetAmount,
       @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.TransactionCurrency,
       _VBRK_BKPF.Plant,
       _VBRK_BKPF.ReferenceSDDocument,
       _VBRK_BKPF.ReferenceSDDocumentItem,
       _VBRK_BKPF.Material,
       PBplace.BusinessPlace,
       MAKT.ProductName,
       @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'BillingQuantityUnit'
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantity,
       @ObjectModel.foreignKey.association: '_BillingQuantityUnit'
       _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit,
       _VBRK_BKPF.BaseUnit,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount,

       LIKP.DeliveryDocument,
       LIKP.ShipToParty,
       LIKP._ShipToParty.BPCustomerName                                                                                                                                             as LBPCustomerName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty.TaxNumber3                                                                                                                                                 as LTaxNumber3,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.CityName                                                                                                                     as LCityName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.DistrictName                                                                                                                 as LDistrictName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.PostalCode                                                                                                                   as LPostalCode,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetName                                                                                                                   as LCStreetName,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                            as LCStreetPrefixName1,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                            as LCStreetPrefixName2,
       LIKP._ShipToParty._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                            as LCStreetSuffixName1,
       t001w.PlantName,
       t001w.AddressID                                                                                                                                                              as PAddressID,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.AddresseeFullName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.CityName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.DistrictName,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.PostalCode,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetPrefixName1,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetPrefixName2,
       t001w._StandardOrganizationAddress.StreetSuffixName1,
       BBRANCH.IN_GSTIdentificationNumber,
       KNA1.Customer,
       KNA1.BPCustomerName,
       KNA1.AddressID                                                                                                                                                               as CAddressID,
       KNA1.TaxNumber3                                                                                                                                                              as CTaxNumber3,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.CityName                                                                                                                                  as CCityName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.DistrictName                                                                                                                              as CDistrictName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.PostalCode                                                                                                                                as CPostalCode,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetName                                                                                                                                as CStreetName,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                                         as CStreetPrefixName1,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                                         as CStreetPrefixName2,
       KNA1._AddressDefaultRepresentation.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                                         as CStreetSuffixName1,
       t001.CompanyCodeName,
       t001.AddressID                                                                                                                                                               as CCAddressID,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.CityName                                                                                                                                       as CCCityName,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.PostalCode                                                                                                                                     as CCPostalCode,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetName                                                                                                                                     as CCStreetName,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetPrefixName1                                                                                                                              as CCStreetPrefixName1,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetPrefixName2                                                                                                                              as CCStreetPrefixName2,
       t001._OrgAddressDefaultRprstn.StreetSuffixName1                                                                                                                              as CCStreetSuffixName1,
       BBRANCH.IN_GSTIdentificationNumber                                                                                                                                           as CCGSTIN,
       EIDOCTYPE.BillingType,
       EIDOCTYPE.InvoiceType,
       EIDOCTYPE.IrnDocType,
       EIDOCTYPE.SupplyType,
       EIDOCTYPE.IrnApp,
       EIDOCTYPE.EwbApp,
       EIDOCTYPE.EwbDocType,
       EIDOCTYPE.ProcessType,

       _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate                                                                                                       as exrate,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       cast ( cast (  _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount as abap.dec( 15, 5 ) ) *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate as abap.curr(15,2) )                                                         as taxvalue,
       @Semantics.amount.currencyCode: 'TransactionCurrency'
       cast ( cast (  _VBRK_BKPF.NetAmount as abap.dec( 15, 5 ) ) *  _VBRK_BKPF.AccountingExchangeRate / cast( _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantity as abap.dec(13,5) )  as abap.curr(15,2 )) as unitprice,
       marc.ConsumptionTaxCtrlCode,
       case
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'kg'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit  = 'KG'
       then 'KGS'
       when _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ea'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'EA'
       then 'NOS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'pc'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'PC'
         or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'st'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ST'
       then 'PCS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'dr'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'DR'
       then 'DRM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ft2' or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'FT2'
       then 'SQF'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'g'   or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'G'
       then 'GMS'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'm2'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'M2'
       then 'SQM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'm3'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'M3'
       then 'CBM'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ml'  or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'ML'
       then 'MLT'
       when  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'paa' or  _VBRK_BKPF.BillingQuantityUnit = 'PAA'
       then 'PRS'
       else 'OTH'
       end                                                                                                                                                                          as zunit,
       _TransactionCurrency,
       _BillingQuantityUnit
}
where
  _VBRK_BKPF.CreationDate = $parameters.iv_fkdat

 

Thank you,

entry.title: Error consuming an API api_purchaserequisition_2 /IWBEP/CM_V4H_RUN/042
entry.content:
Cuando realizo el consumo a trav√©s de SAP Gateway, funciona perfectamente, pero cuando traslado la misma operaci√≥n a mi programa ABAP, el consumo GET se realiza perfectamente, pero el POST me da un error sobre el token, que fue asignado correctamente al m√©todo (creo).

 

Error en api_purchaserequisition_2
c√≥digo /IWBEP/CM_V4H_RUN/042 Mensaje: El token CSRF no es v√°lido CSRF_Token_Missing

 

Aqu√≠ cre√© otra instancia para la solicitud POST, pero si uso la misma, me da el mismo error.

 

error: c√≥digo: /IWBEP/CM_V4H_RUN/042

Mensaje: El token CSRF no es v√°lido.

SAP_common.ExceptionCategory CSRF_Token_Missing

entry.title: Aggregation in RAP Custom Entity (Unmanaged Query) for Fiori List Report
entry.content:
I am working on a complex custom logic report that cannot be achieved using the standard CDS-based approach. Therefore, I decided to implement it using a RAP Custom Entity ‚Äì Unmanaged Query and display the results in a Fiori List Report.

In this List Report, I need to show totals and subtotals for certain amount columns. I tried adding annotations such as:

@OData.applySupportedForAggregation: #FULL
@Aggregation.default: #SUM

However, since this is a Custom Entity, aggregation annotations are not allowed.

I understand that I can implement aggregation logic directly in the query class select method, but for this to work the aggregation request must be triggered from the frontend UI. At the moment, this request is not being sent.

üëâ My questions are:

  • How can aggregation be enabled when creating a RAP-based Fiori List Report with a Custom Entity?
  • Is this feasible at all with Custom Entities, or do we need to handle it differently (e.g., via frontend UI extensions)?

Any guidance or best practices would be greatly appreciated. 

@Andre_Fischer

entry.title: Navigation not appearing in page map for a Custom Page as main entry page
entry.content:
I am trying to build a custom fiori app based on SAP Fiori Elements and Flexible Programming Model. I used 'Custom Page' template from SAP Fiori Generator wizard in BAS. Added a filter bar and a table in the entry page Main.view.xml

<mvc:View xmlns:core="sap.ui.core" xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc" xmlns="sap.m" xmlns:macros="sap.fe.macros"
    xmlns:html="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml" controllerName="com.udhg.zprojectmanage.ext.main.Main">
    <Page id="Main" title="{i18n>MainTitle}">
        <content>
        <VBox id="vBox">
		<macros:FilterBar metaPath="/ZC_PROJECT_INFO/@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.SelectionFields" id="FilterBar" />
		<macros:Table metaPath="/ZC_PROJECT_INFO/@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem" id="LineItemTable" filterBar="FilterBar" initialLoad="false" rowPress="onPressRow" type="GridTable"/>
	</VBox>
        </content>
    </Page>
</mvc:View>

In the 'Page Map', however, when I am trying to add a custom page I cannot see any option to select in navigation dropdown:

I want to add internal navigation to the same entity context 

ZC_PROJECT_INFO when a row is clicked on the table of the main page.
I understand this works with a CAP OData service where I see a navigation property to the same entity, e.g., below metadata

 

But my custom app is based on an ABAP RAP OData service which does not have such a navigation to self. Is this a limitation in SAP Fiori Tools or am I missing something?

 

Best regards,
Sumit
